intro: Dasistoma quercifolia var. integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf dasistoma, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features simple, alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring. Its leaves are typically 3–6 inches long and have a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
